alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 10:51PM EDT until July 04 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Hampshire, including the following county, Cheshire. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated, with minor small stream flooding possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1048 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Swanzey, Winchester, Fitzwilliam, Richmond and Troy.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are dozens of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
